CatDescriptText: Mr. George Wharton, funeral director, Homewood and Mr. Bob Seybold, shipper, 16th Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 17, 1962, pg. A3 with question: "Do you think Bible reading in public schools is constitutional or unconstitutional?" Mr. George Wharton's answer reads: "I think it's constitutional because I'm a religious person."  Mr. Bob Seybold's answer reads: "All depends on the different religions.  I think it's all right to read the Bible in Catholic schools, but I don't think this is all right in public schools."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of George Wharton wearing light colored fedora with dark band and dark overcoat, standing in front of building, Downtown; Portrait of Bob Seybold wearing slicked back hairstyle and corduroy jacket with dark knitted collar, standing in front of buildings, Smithfield Street, Downtown
